Reviews.Title: “Honest, Friendly Service and Top Notch Facilities”
Reviews.Author: FO_Stanley
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 10 day stay at this newer Kempinski property. Needless to say, the size of the rooms is a huge plus, very spacious, great kitchen and terrace. The beds were to die for, very comfortable. We felt like we were sleeping in our beds from home, which usually in a hotel is not the case. The complimentary transfers to Atlantis were much appreciated. Beach, children's pool and pool itself were also wonderful, and the staff was eager to please. Definitely recommend, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a family holiday”
Reviews.Author: Artemis500
Reviews.Content: Good experience throughout - nice big rooms with possibility for in-house dining, nice outdoor area, quiet, nice beach, nice pool area, not too crowded, friendly staff and good service (obvious that staff tried very hard to be excellent). Really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach and view”
Reviews.Author: Lin C
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend and it was a very romantic stay, no noisy, calm and relaxing, inside the Palm so we have the best views over all Dubai (burj al Arab, Khalifa, Marina etc), fantastic breakfast, nice little bar with a very funny pianist, romantic and delighful dinners, nice garden that you can wander around and watch the stars... and the rooms... the rooms... so nice! they look like you are in an european palace! and the beach is one of the best I have seen inside a citty... well kept, clean, organize, the water is amazing and the views to die for... even if it was around 62F when I visit! (I didn´t expect that cold in Dubai, I though it was summer all year round, but if you are lucky and t here is no wind, is still unvelibable). Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxury hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: nathan c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and 2 older children,one of the reasons is not many hotels cater for families!!. On arrival it has the wow factor and the service from the moment we arrived to we left was of an excellent 5* quality. The hotel is spotless and the rooms are extremely extravagent with amazing views over the lagoon or ocean. It isnt too crowded and you couldnt fail to relax there which was a complete contrast as we booked into the Atlantis for 1 night at the end of our stay and it feels like your staying at a train station with all the ebb and flow of people,a very stressfull last night. I would recommend the kempinski to anyone wanting utter luxury and quality

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new hotel but very limited dining options for its size.”
Reviews.Author: Buddyboyy
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in this impressive looking new hotel over February half term with children aged 14 and 11. A real wow factor on arrival especially as two Rolls Royce Phantoms and a Lamborghini parked outside the main entrance. Staff very welcoming and friendly and we were promptly shown to our impressive 2 bedroom suite with three bathrooms! Very spacious rooms and extremely comfortable beds, flat screen tvs and fully fitted kitchen all superb. The pool and beach areas also excellent and I would certainly stay again BUT the dining options are very limited especially if you have taken a half board option. There was little if any selection really suited to children with no 'childrens menu' on offer and we were suprised that there was only one restaurant. Breakfast was good and plenty of selection, but lunchtime always posed problems with waiters as no one was quite sure what food we could have on half board. A poolside menu was available with a good choice but producing a daily menu with the half board option proved difficult on more than one occasion. None of the staff were sure whether the daily beach BBQ was available as a half board option. However the food we did have was good but the hotel needs to provide much more in the way of half board and childrens menus. Despite the hotel still only 6 months old it seems staff training in the dining room needs addressing! On one occasion our cutlery was changed three times before we had seen any food! I would recommend staying but only on a bed and breakfast basis and eat out in the evening in one of the amazing shopping malls taking the free shuttle bus service or a taxi. Note also that children are not allowed in the bar area next to the dining room so there is no facility to enjoy a pre dinner drink unless its at your table. The hotel was booked through British Airways and I would add that the package was a good price with excellent transfers, a large BMW was our vehicle to the hotel and two cars took us back to the airport, an Audi A8 and a Mercedes! The BA flight was good on schedule both ways, although the World Traveller food is still not as good as Emirates!

Reviews.Title: “WoW Facility & Very Poor Services”
Reviews.Author: komosani
Reviews.Content: This hotel considered to be one of the luxury hotels in Dubai. The facilities (rooms, beach, restaurant…etc) are well structured with top notch furnitures. However, this is does not justify the poor service and ignorance of our requests. We didn’t feel that we are valuable customers. I stayed along with my family in two suites for 8 nights and paid almost 40,000 SAR (13,260 $) and they treated us as a normal or even less valuable customer. This really made me disappointed and I talked with their management several times but unfortunately no response. Upon my arrival to my home I sent another letter to Kempinski management but again they didn’t give me any feedback. One point to add, the housekeeping was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably poor service”
Reviews.Author: jasonlb
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry...kempinski pride themselves by the notion that they've been in the hotel business for over 100 years. If you were unfortunate enough to be at this one in the first week of January, you'd think they'd never run a hotel before! Where to start? Arrived early, room not ready. Not a problem. They suggested breakfast. It was cold. Went to first room. It overlooked a construction site. It hadn't been snagged and there were no electrical sockets. You couldn't even plug the bed side lamps in. We were moved to another room, which had been snagged. It was excellent. Feeling better... First night...gas is cut off. No hot food! Are they serious? Forced Decamp to Atlantis...amazing. Day two; Pool - service is the worst I have experienced any where in the world ever! (including the carribean - at least the Bajans are cool In being slow!) - it took 45 mins to get a glass of sprite (provided you went to remind them after 40 mins). Pool bar wasn't open. Pool restaurant was still being built (despite a reassurance from the hotel directly before I booked that everything was finished). Not particularly relaxing while they cut tiles for the badly needed 2nd restaurant. Shall I go on? Ah..being woken at 2am as a dozy cleaner decides that it is the best time to use a floor cleaning machine outside our room door!? The service staff are simply appalling, with the exception of the spa staff who were great. The spa - actually it isnt really a spa! It is some treatment rooms; no jacuzzi, no sauna, no steam...spa is a slightly optimistic description. Gym; rubbish. Two treadmills is hardly sufficient for the size of the complex. Went three times; three times returned having not used equipment, because they were in use. Lunch - it took one hour for the pool staff to bring the menu! It became a standing joke. By the end of the week, we had spent time purposefully away from the hotel because the service was doing my head in. I even went to a supermarket to buy my own drinks so I didn't have to ask anyone for a drink? Can you believe it? I certainly can't... I brought it to the attention of management...did they sort it? Did they make it better? No. It actually got worse. The manager actually suggested I went to stay elsewhere, which makes me sound like the guest from hell. I'm not. I have never written a review before. I have never before felt compelled to write to a hotel manager whilst in residence to outline the extensive issues I faced. To suggest I go elsewhere was insulting. The rooms were great and I suspect once phase two is complete and the staff have been (a) sacked (b) more recruited and (c) trained...this will one day be a fabulous resort. As of now it isn't...I may try it again in 2-3 years time.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Experience, unprofessional service”
Reviews.Author: Madhan S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights to celebrate an occassion, but the stay was totally unpleasant. Looks fabulous from outside but not worth the feel. The staff needed to be reminded several times for things requested. Lacks training. Not worth the stay at all. Despite sending a complaint to the management, there was no action taken.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay at Kempinski”
Reviews.Author: JaysonLO
Reviews.Content: It was a very new hotel, opening in September. We stayed in a two-bedroom suite. The room was very spacious but most of the information is in Russian and German. We ordered Room Service which was better than our expectations though the prices were high. The private beach and pool were nice. The nearby area was still underdevelopment, so nothing was found nearby. It was good that they provided complimentary drive to Atlantis, and so we spent some time there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: TKay_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kempinski Palm Jumeirah for six nights in December 2011 and it was the best six nights of 2011. It was paradise. I cannot fault anything about the hotel. All the staff including concierge, reception, restaurant and bar staff, housekeeping, lifeguards, spa staff, kids club - everyone was exceptional. The service was impeccable. The hotel location is stunning, felt like paradise. The views from our suite was amazing. Each room had a terrace and there was also a large terrace by the living room. We had views of all the key landmarks in Dubai including Atlantis hotel, Burj Al Arab, Burj Khalifa, Twin Towers, financial district etc. Dubai is full of amazing hotels but I will always go back to Kempinski solely because of the level of service I received. If you are looking for ultimate luxury and relaxation in Dubai, I highly recommend you stay at this hotel - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure for the senses”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: I satyed at this hotel 3 weeks ago and I still miss everything about it. The atmosphere, the staff and the food were outstanding! I miss those days when I felt like a real princess!! I will definitely come back next year or even sooner if I can

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday in my life”
Reviews.Author: kryspin
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely unforgettable stay in my life. Great staff (they help me with every my problem), fantastic location (Is great to be part of Palm Jumeirah) and I must try more things on the next trip (like spa or gym). You will feel like in paradise... Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: Eamonn W
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay in Kempinski Palm for 5 nights with my family in late October. I had stayed in the Kempinski, Mall of the Emirates the previous month for business and heard about their new hotel on the Palm. We were advised that the hotel was on soft opening so there would be no alcohol on premises during our stay, a sacrifice but not a huge one as on previous visits we would normally go out at night anyway and we could stock our room bar with duty free anyway. Our first impression on arrival was Wow at the look of the hotel from the outside, it is stunning. However the reception area late at night wasn't quite as impressive but they are still building and some of the reception shops are yet to open. We were then brought to our two bed room which was huge! The room looked fantastic, the bedrooms were very spacious with plenty of room for a family of 5. We also had a huge open reception room and a very large kitchen. Outside we had a very spacious balcony as we were right over reception. There was however a problem, our room smelled of cigarette smoke and there were butts and an empty packet left outside on the patio. Normally i wouldn't complain but it was quite a strong smell. Also we had requested a room with an outside Jacuzzi and were told there was none available. We decided to just get to bed as it was late and let management know the next day. The next day Matti really took hold of our complaint and said he would do his very best to change us to a better room. He duely delivered on his promise and had us upgraded to a 4 bed suite which was HUGE ! When we got there we were all stunned at the size of the room. 4 huge bedrooms, two huge reception areas upstairs and down, 3 patios and one with a jacuzzi. Amazing! After that the service was excellent although at times slow at the beach area. The pool and beach area was very nice and extremely clean and new. We felt very well looked after and really enjoyed the stay from that point on. The staff at reception were great especially Norman and Matti who made us feel really welcome. Overall i would highly recommend the Kempinski Palm and we hope to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “not good!”
Reviews.Author: caroline w
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay a week, left within 24 hours. We were not informed about the " soft opening". noisy construction going on at the pool. Waited 45 minutes for a coke. Food was expensive and below the standard of a five star hotel. Salad with tuna from a can.... Received an e-mail two days prior to arrival that the hotel did not have a liqor license. Staf was very friendly and apologizing. Hotel suite was good. Hope Kempinski sorts out their staff shortage soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Marcelina_56
Reviews.Content: It was a very soothing experience. And now I plan to come to this place once every year. Its truly a rejuvinating experience. Indeed the hospitality was great. Best resort breakfast ever!! chefs took care us, My family enjoyed to their extreme. It was really a wonderful experience on the days we spent in Kempinski Palm Jumeirah!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lotus35
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel i have ever stayed And the prices are very reasonable according to other hotel prices in dubai

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Retreat on the Palm”
Reviews.Author: jillyp4perfect
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of an educational trip with work. It is on 'soft opening' so it will be a dry hotel until 10th October (approx.) when they get their licenses. Then they plan on having more bar areas etc. I stayed in a two bedroom suite and on opening the door it certainly has 'wow' factor - beautiful rooms, elegantly designed with a parisian feel, our rooms was decorated with blues and silvers with fantastic furniture, big kitchen with plenty of facilities. We had 3 balconies with sea views and also Atlantis view. Beautiful on a morning to opening the curtains to such a gorgeous setting. Overlooking the Villa properties - which I had the honour of looking around and they too are finished to a high standard, great for a family or group holiday. Some rooms have Jacuzzis on the balcony and you could really imagine sitting in there watching the sunset. Staff were friendly. Food was great - They have a chef who loves to experiment with A la Carte dishes. Beach and pool area were beautiful. The complex will when completed plans to have 18 (approx) eateries from what I gathered will be almost a mini mall style area, however not completed so cannot comment. Kids Club was small but good for smaller children - they did say they would be making this larger in the near future. Lots of safe areas for the kids. Overall based on my two night stay I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “I´ll be back !”
Reviews.Author: abroad_11
Reviews.Content: During my Business trip through United Arab Emirates I had the opportunity to stay at Kempinski Palm Jumeirah (just a 5 min transfer from Atlantis); this paradise is pure luxury and the perfect place for relaxation, romantic and sophisticated diversions for all ages. The room’s with outdoor whirlpools featuring outstanding Dubai Skyline and see View. The kindness of staff gave us the feel of being welcome and great wellbeing, I wish to stay forever. The best one in all! Special thanks for excellent service to the unique front desk team. It was a great experience to stay with you. I will definitely return and recommend the Kempinski Palm Jumerirah to my business colleagues, friends and relatives. Sincerely. RP

Reviews.Title: “Dreamworks Spa at Kempinski Dubai Palm - Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: cfo-dubai
Reviews.Content: We just tried the new Dreamworks Spa at Kempinski Palm Jumeirah, Dubai, and it was excellent. Although the hotel is in "soft opening", it is a wonderful property with beautiful views of the Palm.

HotelInfo.Name: Kempinski Hotel & Residences Palm Jumeirah
HotelInfo.Address: The Crescent West | Palm Jumeirah, Dubai 213208, United Arab Emirates
